title: Labor Party victory post war Britain

content.prompt: Despite the wartime leadership of Conservative prime minister Winston Churchill, the Conservative Party was defeated by the Labor Party in the British elections of 1945 largely because of

choices.label: widespread frustration over the failure of Britain to develop the atomic bomb
fear that Churchill would prove weak in postwar dealings with the Soviet Union
concern that Churchill and the Conservative Party would not do enough to alleviate economic hardship in postwar Britain
worries that joining the United Nations would make it impossible for Britain to have an independent foreign policy
popular desire to maintain British imperial rule in India for as long as possible

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Identify and describe a historical context for a specific historical development or process.
